CTFApi

                              CTFApi.CaptureTheFlagApi
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICaptureTheFlagApi, java.lang.Runnable, IExtensionApi, robocode.robotinterfaces.IAdvancedEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IAdvancedRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicEvents2, robocode.robotinterfaces.IBasicRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IInteractiveEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IInteractiveRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IObjectEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IObjectRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.IPaintEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IPaintRobot, robocode.robotinterfaces.ITeamEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.ITeamRobot
public class CaptureTheFlagApi
extends TeamRobot
implements ICaptureTheFlagApi, robocode.robotinterfaces.IObjectEvents, robocode.robotinterfaces.IObjectRobot

The API used for capturing the flag of enemy and bringing it to home base.

CTFApi package is to be used for the battles involving capturing the flag of enemy and bringing it to home. In such battles, a team will be assigned a home base and home flag. The team has to capture the enemy flag and bring it back to home base. CaptureTheFlagApi may be used to know the coordinates of team's own flag, enemy's flag, own base and enemy's base. Note that each robot must call the 'registerMe' function of this class before using any other function of this API.

Author:
Joshua Galecki (original), Himanshu Singh (contributor)
See Also:
Codefest, Virtual Combat, Building your first CTF robot, AdvancedRobot, JuniorRobot, Robot, TeamRobot, Droid

CaptureTheFlagApi

public CaptureTheFlagApi()
Method Detail

registerMe

public void registerMe()
The function called by a robot to register itself in the battle of capturing the flag.

This function must be called by every robot which uses the CTFApi package. The function should be called as the first statement of run() function of the robot.

See Also:
Robot

isTeammate

public boolean isTeammate(java.lang.String otherName)
Returns true if a given robot is a teammate of the robot calling this function.

This call helps a robot in knowing whether a scanned robot is a teammate or not.

Specified by:

Returns:

isEnemyFlagAtBase

public boolean isEnemyFlagAtBase()
Checks whether the enemy flag is present in enemy base.

This call helps in identifying if the enemy flag has been shifted out of the enemy base by some teammate.

Specified by:
isEnemyFlagAtBase in interface ICaptureTheFlagApi
Returns:
true if enemy flag is present inside the enemy's base, false otherwise.

isOwnFlagAtBase

public boolean isOwnFlagAtBase()
Checks whether the robot's own flag is present inside the home base.

This call helps in identifying if the enemy flag has been shifted out of the enemy base by some teammate.

Specified by:
isOwnFlagAtBase in interface ICaptureTheFlagApi
Returns:
true if enemy flag is present inside the enemy's base, false otherwise.

UpdateBattlefieldState

public void UpdateBattlefieldState(java.util.List<java.lang.String> state)
The function to update the state of the battlefield

This function should be called if a robot wants to update its knowledge of changes in battlefield. The changes may include change in coordinates of flags and robots.

Specified by:
UpdateBattlefieldState in interface IExtensionApi
